ai.summary: The Llŷn Coastal Path is a demanding 311.1 km coastal traverse around the Llŷn Peninsula in Wales, UK. Expect long stretches of cliff-top paths, sandy beaches, tidal estuaries, and expansive sea views. The route crosses remote headlands and small coastal settlements, requiring good fitness, navigation, and preparedness for changeable weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly exposed coastal terrain with a mix of rugged cliff paths, rocky tracks, beach sections, and occasional farmland lanes. Surface quality ranges from firm tracks to eroded paths and soft sand; expect uneven footing, gusty winds, and sections where careful footing is needed near cliff edges. Tidal conditions can affect parts of the route, so plan beach crossings around tides.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide tables and weather forecasts before beach or estuary crossings. The coast is exposed and weather can change rapidly—layer your clothing, bring a waterproof shell and a warm layer, and wear sturdy, grippy boots. Many sections are remote with limited mobile coverage; carry a charged phone, a power bank, and a map/compass. Plan accommodation or campsites ahead and tell someone your route and expected timings. Carry enough water and high-energy food for longer stretches, and consider a light first aid kit and blister care. In emergencies, use a whistle and know local emergency numbers; be prepared to alter plans if seas, storms, or waves make sections unsafe.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good ankle support
Weatherproof jacket and layered clothing (base layer, fleece, insulating layer)
Sun hat or cap and sunglasses
Map and compass or dedicated GPS device (with offline maps)
Fully charged phone with offline maps and a power bank
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 litres per day, depending on conditions)
Small first aid kit (blister care, antiseptic, plasters)
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Lightweight dry bags or waterproof stuff sacks
Tide tables or coastal navigation knowledge
Thermal blanket or bivy sack (for emergencies)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offers milder conditions and longer days, but the coast can still be windy and wet; be prepared for changeable weather year‑round.
